Policy of Discrimination against Part-time Workers Denounced in S. Korea
articles.content:
Policy of Discrimination against Part-time Workers Denounced in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- The "Federation of Korean Trade Unions" held a workers' rally in front of the building of "Kukmin Bank" in Youido,
Seoul on Feb. 15 with more than 1,000 workers attending to demand the authorities withdraw their policy of discrimination against the part-time workers, according to south Korean MBC.
 The organization demanded the authorities make the part-time jobs in the public field full-time, enact a law banning the discrimination against the part-time jobs and guarantee three rights to labor to the specially hired workers.    
 Branding the self-immolation committed by Pak Il Su, a worker of the Hyundai Heavy Industries Co., Ltd. on Feb. 14 as a social tragedy caused by the policy of discrimination against the part-time workers, the organization declared that it would wage a powerful struggle to put an end to the discrimination.

articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to King of Morocco
    Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of sympathy to Mohamed VI, king of Morocco.
 Upon hearing the sad news that a strong earthquake that hit Morocco caused much loss of life and materials, he in the message expressed deep sympathy and condolences to the king and, through him, the victims and their bereaved families.

articles.title: FM Meets New Zimbabwean Ambassador
articles.content:
FM Meets New Zimbabwean Ambassador
    Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- Paek Nam Sun, foreign minister of the DPRK, met and had a talk with Christopher H. Mutsvangwa, new Zimbabwean ambassador to the DPRK, who paid a courtesy call on him today.
